title: Weald Country Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Robin Lucas / Weald Country Park, Brentwood
images.caption: Lake view at the park in the spring of 2007

images.title: Robert Edwards / Part of Weald Country Park, South Weald
images.caption: Part of Weald Country Park, South Weald

images.title: John Winfield / A fallen willow - South Weald
images.caption: A fallen willow by the lake

images.title: John Winfield / Weald Country Park, South Weald, Essex
images.caption: The photograph shows the area of the park which was designated for the mountain bike event in the 2012 Olympic Games. However, following a visit by inspectors from the Union Cycliste Internationale, the site was considered insufficiently challenging for international competition and a new venue was sought. Hadleigh Country Park was chosen as the replacement venue.

images.title: John Winfield / Fallow Deer - South Weald
images.caption: Fallow Deer - South Weald. A deer park was recorded in South Weald as long ago as the 11th century. Now part of the 500 acre Weald Country Park has been set aside for this herd of fallow deer.

images.title: Robert Edwards / A view of South Weald church from Weald Country Park
images.caption: A view of South Weald church from Weald Country Park.

images.title: John Winfield / Grazing cattle - The Park, South Weald
images.caption: Grazing cattle. Grazing has been re-introduced to the park in order to create natural flower meadows.

images.title: Parkland oaks, Weald Country Park by Robin Webster, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Parkland oaks in summer.

description: Enjoy lakes, tree-lined avenues, parkland and woodland in this 500 acre country park in Brentwood, Essex. The park is excellent for cyclists and walkers with a large number of tracks and footpaths to enjoy. An expansive area of the park is sectioned of for the large collection of deer. They are very friendly and will come over to eat out of your hands. The park also has a large lake with a variety of winged visitors and a bird hide. There are also very good facilities with a visitor centre and cafe.  Weald Country Park is located in Brentwood and is an ideal countryside escape from London. You can find the visitor centre and car park at postcode CM14 5QS for your sat navs. It's located about a mile or so north west of Brentwood town centre which also has a train station if you would like to come by public transport.
